intro: Buchnera, commonly known as the common buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its showy, usually yellow or white flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Buchnera species are typically found in moist, temperate regions and are often associated with wetlands or stream banks. The plant produces small, greenish or yellowish fruits that contain numerous seeds. Buchnera plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various insects.
